interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Samurai Trilogy (The Criterion Collection) [Blu-ray]
Review Date: 2015/04/07
Store: Toshiro Mifune  (Actor),     Hiroshi Inagaki  (Director)    Rated:    NR    Format: Blu-ray
Categories: Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies
Product Description: ['The Samurai Trilogy, directed by Hiroshi Inagaki (The Rickshaw Man) and starring the inimitable Toshiro Mifune (Seven Samurai), was one of Japan’s most successful exports of the 1950s, a rousing, emotionally gripping tale of combat and self-discovery. Based on a novel that’s often called Japan’s Gone with the Wind, this sweeping saga fictionalizes the life of the legendary seventeenth-century swordsman (and writer and artist) Musashi Miyamoto, following him on his path from unruly youth to enlightened warrior. With these three films—1954’s Oscar-winning Musashi Miyamoto, 1955’s Duel at Ichijoji Temple, and 1956’s Duel at Ganryu Island—Inagaki created a passionate epic that’s equal parts tender love story and bloody action.']
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure', 'Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Contributor': 'Hiroshi Inagaki, Toshiro Mifune', 'Language': 'Japanese', 'Runtime': '5 hours', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'Relay time: 300min; 2 Videos', 'Director': 'Hiroshi Inagaki', 'Media Format': 'Blu-ray', 'Run time': '5 hours', 'Release date': 'June 26, 2012', 'Actors': 'Toshiro Mifune', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Criterion Collection', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '2'}
Review Text: Enjoyed the 3 discs. Prompt delivery. Thank you.
Review Title: Five Stars
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

This user demonstrates a strong appreciation for classic cinema, particularly Japanese film, as evidenced by their purchase of a well-regarded historical trilogy featuring a prominent actor and director. Their focus on high-quality formats, such as Blu-ray, indicates a preference for superior viewing experiences. The user values storytelling that blends action with emotional depth, as highlighted by their enjoyment of a narrative that encompasses themes of combat and self-discovery. A positive review rating (5.0) showcases their satisfaction with the product and the efficiency of the service received, suggesting they likely prioritize prompt and reliable delivery in their shopping experiences. Overall, this user tends to favor culturally rich, artistically significant films, especially those that feature acclaimed performances and a historical context.
